channel.title: CyberNetSec - Ransomware
channel.description: Latest ransomware threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Health-ISAC Report: AI-Enabled Attacks Named Top Threat to Healthcare Sector in 2026
item.description:
The Health Information Sharing and Analysis Center (Health-ISAC) has released its 2026 Global Health Sector Threat Landscape report, identifying AI-enabled attacks as the number one projected concern for the year. Based on surveys of healthcare executives and security professionals, the report highl...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Policy and Compliance, Ransomware

Read Full Article →

item.title: Everest Ransomware Leaks Data of 72 Million Under Armour Customers After Failed Talks
item.description:
The Everest ransomware group has claimed a massive data breach against athletic apparel giant Under Armour. After negotiations allegedly failed, the group announced on its dark web leak site that it has published the full dataset, which it claims contains 191 million records, including 72.7 million ...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: New 'Osiris' Ransomware Borrows TTPs from Medusa and Inc Gangs, Uses Signed Driver to Kill AV
item.description:
A new ransomware strain named Osiris is demonstrating a high level of sophistication by combining tactics from established ransomware groups like Medusa and Inc. The attackers use Rclone for data exfiltration to Wasabi cloud storage and deploy a version of Mimikatz named `kaz.exe`, both TTPs linked ...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Malware, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: New QuantumLeap Ransomware Demands $50M, Halts Global Shipments at NaviGistics
item.description:
The global logistics firm NaviGistics has suffered a catastrophic cyberattack from a new ransomware strain dubbed 'QuantumLeap'. The attack, orchestrated by a group calling itself 'Entropy Collective', has encrypted critical systems and brought the company's worldwide shipping and freight operations...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Medusa Ransomware Exploits Cybersecurity Gaps, Escalating Attacks Across Africa
item.description:
Ransomware attacks are a pervasive and highly damaging threat across the African continent, where a significant cybersecurity skills and resources gap creates a fertile ground for cybercriminals. Notorious ransomware groups, including Medusa, are increasingly targeting organizations in the region, l...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

item.title: Phishing Campaign Hits Russia with Amnesia RAT, Uses GitHub and Dropbox for Payload Delivery
item.description:
A sophisticated, multi-stage phishing campaign is targeting users in Russia, delivering a combination of the Amnesia remote access trojan (RAT) and ransomware. The attack, analyzed by Fortinet FortiGuard Labs, is notable for its use of public cloud services like GitHub and Dropbox to host payloads a...

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Malware, Ransomware

Read Full Article →

item.title: Everest Ransomware Group Leaks 343GB of Under Armour Customer Data
item.description:
The Russia-linked Everest ransomware group has leaked 343 GB of data allegedly stolen from global sportswear brand Under Armour. The massive data dump, which occurred on January 24, 2026, followed a failed extortion attempt. The leaked data is reported to contain the personally identifiable informat...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: DragonForce Ransomware Claims Attack on U.S. Bank, Threatens Data Leak
item.description:
The DragonForce ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack against Uinta Bank, a community bank based in Wyoming, USA. In a post on their data leak site on January 23, 2026, the threat actors announced the breach and threatened to publish a "full dump" of the bank's data if negoti...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: INC Ransomware OPSEC Fail: Reused Infrastructure Leads to Data Recovery for 12 U.S. Victims
item.description:
A significant operational security (OPSEC) failure by the INC ransomware group has allowed cybersecurity firm Cyber Centaurs to recover stolen data for twelve U.S. organizations. The discovery was made after analyzing an attack involving the RainINC ransomware variant. Researchers found artifacts fr...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Ransomware, Incident Response, Threat Actor

item.title: Anubis RaaS Ups the Ante with Destructive 'Wipe Mode' to Maximize Extortion
item.description:
A new Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) operation named Anubis is gaining attention for its destructive capabilities. Evolving from a prototype called 'Sphinx,' Anubis offers its affiliates a dual-execution model. In addition to standard encryption, the malware can be run with a `/WIPEMODE` parameter t...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Malware, Threat Actor
